d11546057fc9297eaf847de791076e3b (01:19): I've got a selection of a mesh I want to have a separate texture. I separated it, assigned the separate texture, and then joined it. This works but if I want to change the texture later, is there a way (or a better way to set this up)?
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (01:20): uhm, what you are doing is accomplishing nothing

be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (01:22): (maby it makes a new vertex ground) but the assigned material will be the same; and instead of enabling tex-face for the material i advice on assignen a texture which uses UV info
d11546057fc9297eaf847de791076e3b (01:28): I rendered it, charolastra, and it displayed both materials.
d11546057fc9297eaf847de791076e3b (01:28): I was using UV and I got distracted, so I'll go back to that.
d11546057fc9297eaf847de791076e3b (01:28): I've got a selection of a mesh I want to have a separate Material.
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (01:29): the magic word is "vertex groups" found in F/
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (01:31): basicly you add a new material to the object; select the vertices, change the number there to the one which is the same as the material and press assigne

3d0852aac731384c3b789eac0ccae8b6 (02:20): do i have to tell it to glue somehow when i am finished aligning the unwrap? cause the 3d view is not changing?
399b7d3894484af893f4662ba342e8ea (02:22): sanabriamusic- you're in textured view yes?
399b7d3894484af893f4662ba342e8ea (02:22): because if you're in shaded view, you won't see a difference
3d0852aac731384c3b789eac0ccae8b6 (02:23): it was already mapped wrong and thats what i keep seeing
399b7d3894484af893f4662ba342e8ea (02:23): ah. mmm, well what I know is that it's rather finicky, and that sometimes reloading the image in the uv editor might help
399b7d3894484af893f4662ba342e8ea (02:23): because it should be real-time updates
399b7d3894484af893f4662ba342e8ea (02:29): it's to use the image on the filesystem, instead of the one packed in the .blend file
